chapter.title: Libraries
chapter.para:
Several libraries are needed to build / run Ethereal. Most of the libraries are splitted into three packages:
Runtime package: binaries (e.g. win32 DLL's) and alike
Developer package: documentation, header files and alike
Source package: library sources, usually not required to build ethereal
Win32: The library formats for GCC (cygwin) .a and MSVC .lib are different, only the MSVC library variants are currently recommended / supported.

note.title: Note!
note.para: It's a good idea to use the setup target described below to install the required libraries.

section.title: Win32 setup target
section.para: If you have the required tools installed, you can download/install all required libraries by using the setup target of the Makefile.nmake from the source package.
Be sure to edit the line containing the ETHEREAL_LIBS setting in the config.nmake file to your favourite place.

This will download and install (unpack) all required libraries into the ETHEREAL_LIBS directory.
